There are moments, though, when the facade cracks, and the grief I've been holding at bay comes flooding back, threatening to engulf me. It's then that I'm forced to confront the reality of my loss, to acknowledge the void that can never be filled, and to find a way to keep moving forward, no matter how difficult it may be. Time, they say, heals all wounds, but I'm not so sure; it's more like time helps you learn to live with the scars, to find a way to make them a part of who you are, without letting them define you. And so, I'll keep moving, one step at a time, into a future that's uncertain, but mine to shape, a future where the memory of her will always be a part of me, but not the only part.
